abstract: The Pentagon and Lockheed Martin reached an agreement in principle for 32 of the jets after a year of tense negotiations to lower costs.
snippet: The Pentagon and Lockheed Martin reached an agreement in principle for 32 of the jets after a year of tense negotiations to lower costs.
lead_paragraph: The Pentagon and Lockheed Martin reached an agreement in principle on Friday on the price of a fifth batch of F-35 fighter jets after a year of tense negotiations over how to lower costs.

headline.main: U.S. to Pay $3.8 Billion for Next Lot of F-35 Jets
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Pay $3.8 Billion For Next Lot Of F-35 Jets
